name: 2002 World Cup Quiz | FIFA World Cup | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which Brazillian made the mistake that let in Michael Owen for England's goal in the quarter-final?
questions.explanation:
Lucio.

	Brazil won 2-1 after being 1-0 down.

questions.text: Who were the joint top scorers for Spain in the tournament?
questions.explanation:
Raul & Morientes.

	Raul and Morientes both scored three. Hierro scored two.

questions.text: Which team(s) beat U.S.A during the tournament?
questions.explanation:
Germany and Poland.

	U.S.A lost to Poland (3-1) in the group stages, and to Germany (1-0) in the quarter-finals.

questions.text: Which Irish player missed a second half penalty against Spain in the second round?
questions.explanation:
Ian Harte.

	Fortunately for Harte, the Irish were awarded another penalty which Robbie Keane scored. The game ended 1-1 after extra time, and Spain won the penalty shoot out.

questions.text: Which Belgian player had a 'perfectly good' goal disallowed against Brazil in the second round?
questions.explanation:
Marc Wilmots.

	Brazil eventually won 2-0, but were lucky not to lose as Belgium were the better team.

questions.text: In the group stages, which team came back from 3-0 down at half time to draw the game 3-3?
questions.explanation:
Uruguay.

	Senegal were leading 3-0, but Uruguay came back in the second half and were unlucky not to win the match.

questions.text: Which of these players failed to score in the tournament?
questions.explanation:
Luis Figo.

	Batistuta scored for Argentina against Nigeria, Del Piero for Italy against Mexico. Crespo for Argentina aginst Sweden.

questions.text: Who scored both goals for Senegal when they knocked Sweden out in the second round?
questions.explanation:
Henri Camara.

	Camara scored the golden goal after the match finished 1-1 at the end of ninety minutes.

questions.text: Which player in the tournament gained a reputation for his series of extravagant somersaults when he celebrates a goal?
questions.explanation:
Julius Aghahowa.

	Aghahowa only scored the one goal during the tournament. His team, Nigeria, were knocked out in the group stages.

questions.text: Which player had his name spelt incorrectly on the back of his shirt?
questions.explanation:
Mauricio Wright.

	Wright was spelt Wrigth. He plays for Costa Rica.
